alert.note: Alert for Fort Bend; Harris (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 3:42PM CST until further notice by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Houston/Galveston TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Cypress Creek Near Sharp Road affecting Fort Bend and Harris Counties. For the Cypress Creek...including Sharp Road...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cypress Creek Near Sharp Road. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:35 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 165.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:35 PM CST Wednesday was 165.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 166.4 feet just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 164.2 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 166.5 feet on 03/11/2016. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (3 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Cypress Creek Sharp Road 164.2 165.2 Wed 3 pm CST 166.3 165.9 MSG &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 345 AM CST.
